question: A 45-year-old man with a duodenal ulcer was treated with a combination of drugs intended to heal the mucosal damage and to eradicate Helicobacter pylori (H. pylori). Which of the following antibacterial drugs is used commonly to eradicate this organism?
Intestinal chyme stimulates the gastric secretion of about 10% of the acid in response to the meal. This early intestinal phase of stomach secretion is stimulated by which of the following?
Which of the following syndromes represent the syndrome of iron deficiency anemia, glossitis, and dysphagia?

A 39-year-old woman presents with complaints of intermittent attacks of mild diarrhea, fever, and abdominal pain spaced by an asymptomatic period lasting for weeks to months. On physical examination, there are no remarkable findings. GI endoscopy reveals a thick rubbery intestinal wall. In addition, the radiography shows a string sign. Biopsies are performed in this region. Which of the following is the most classical finding of this condition?
Cardiac arrest and small bowel ulcers are the main nutritional toxicity symptoms of which essential macro-mineral?
Deterioration of food (rancidity) is due to the presence of which of the following?
A patient with a history of arthritis for the last nine years develops hematemesis. What is the most common cause?

A 3-month-old male baby was brought to the outpatient department (OPD) with effortless spitting. The mother gave the history of on and off vomiting since 2nd week of life. On examination, weight was found to be 5 kg. What is the most likely diagnosis?

A 28-year-old male patient presents to the emergency department with painful swelling 2 cm above the umbilicus. The swelling is well-defined and mushroom-shaped. On examination, cough impulse is negative, the umbilicus is usual in appearance and inverted. A diagnosis of a ventral hernia is made. Which one of the following can not be a hernia content in this patient?
The increase in blood glucose after a test dose of carbohydrate compared with that after an equivalent amount of glucose is known as:
Which one of the following is not a manifestation of shaken baby syndrome?
Which of the following is true for the investigations in a case of suspected intussusception?

answers.option: Ultrasonography can predict irreducibility of intussusception using pneumatic reduction
Abdominal radiograph is a first line investigation to confirm the diagnosis of intussusception
At ultrasonography, a doughnut sign on longitudinal section is diagnostic
At ultrasonography, a pseudo kidney sign on transverse section is diagnostic

question: The patient accidentally took fluid, which was stored in Pepsi Cola’s bottle. He has started passing orange-colored urine, this can be due to poisoning from:
A 45-year-old male with a known case of hepatitis C develops hematemesis. He also has ascites. What is the most common cause?

A 48-year-old female patient is brought to the emergency department with complaints of severe epigastric pain for 1 day, which became generalized and more severe for 3 hours. The pain is associated with vomiting, and she cannot tolerate even a liquid diet. She has a history of NSAID use for osteoarthritis for a long time. Her pulse is 120 beats/min, her blood pressure (BP) is 100/60 mmHg, she is afebrile, and her respiratory rate is 32 breaths/min. She has a tense tender abdomen with board-like rigidity. Gut sounds are inaudible. What is the most likely diagnosis in this patient?
What is true for the pugilistic attitude of a dead body?

answers.option: It occurs in antemortem burns only
It occurs in postmortem burns only
It does not occur in burns
It may occur in both antemortem and postmortem burns

question: Prolong prothrombin time occurs in case of poisoning with:

Biopsy of a small and rounded rectal polyp demonstrates glands and saw tooth crypts composed of a proliferation of goblet and columnar epithelial cells. No atypia is seen. This polyp is best classified as which of the following?

A 45-year-old male patient was diagnosed with peptic ulcer for the last 1 year and is on maintenance therapy with antacid along with histamine (H2) receptor blocker. Recently, the patient came to the gastroenterology outpatient department (OPD) with concern that his cardiologist asked him to choose an alternative option for H2 receptor blocker because prescribed H2 receptor blocker can affect the metabolism of other prescribed drugs. Which histamine H2 blocker has the most marked inhibitory effect on microsomal cytochrome P-450 enzyme?
Which of the following is the most common benign salivary gland tumor?
A 50-year-old male smoker was diagnosed with peritonitis secondary to a perforated duodenal ulcer. The most likely organisms found in this patient:

In which of the following transitional stage in demography, both birth, and death rates are low. Birth rates may drop to well below replacement level as has happened in some of the European countries. What demographic stage could it be?
A formal statement of the nutrition goals and interventions prescribed for an individual using the data obtained from a nutrition assessment is termed as:

A 9-month-old female baby weighing 8 kg is brought to the emergency department with the complaint of loose motions for the last 3 days. On examination, the baby is irritable and her eyes are sunken. She is eager to drink and her skin pinch goes back slowly. What is the most likely diagnosis according to the IMNCI protocol?

A 54-year-old man presents with 5 months of upper abdominal pain accompanied by nausea. He does not have hematemesis. Physical examination is unremarkable, and laboratory workup reveals stool sample positive for occult blood. Upper gastrointestinal endoscopy is performed, and gastric biopsies are taken. On microscopic examination, they reveal acute and chronic mucosal inflammation along with the presence of Helicobacter pylori organisms. The presence of these organisms is most likely to be associated with which of the following?
A 50-year-old male develops melena. What could be the probable cause?

A 10-year-old female child weighing 30 kg was brought to you with complaints of fever, fatigue, loss of appetite, nausea, vomiting, abdominal pain, passing dark urine, and clay-colored stools for the last 3 days. The most likely diagnosis is:
The type of additive required in foods containing fats and oils to prevent rancidity is called:
During absorption of carbohydrates, a transporter that transports glucose and galactose against their concentration gradients is used, which is:

A 45-year-old man has had vague abdominal pain and nausea for the past 3 years. This pain is unrelieved by antacid medications. He has no difficulty swallowing and no heartburn following meals. On physical examination, there are no abnormal findings. Upper gastrointestinal endoscopy reveals antral mucosal erythema, but no ulcerations or masses. Biopsies are taken, and microscopically there is chronic non-specific gastritis. Which of the following conditions is most likely to be present in this man?
95% of cancers of the head and neck are:

A patient with Crohn’s disease presented to emergency with complaints of absolute constipation and vomiting. A short narrowing is noted in the mid transverse colon. What would be the most likely option to treat his condition?
In severe upper gastrointestinal bleed, the patient has:
Which of the following is not safe in patients with celiac disease?
A 60-year-old-female presented with abdominal pain and weight loss. Her ultrasound shows lesions in the liver. What is the next appropriate investigation?

A 27-year-old man is brought to the emergency room for trauma to head from a fight. Upon examination, there is a swelling in the right temporal region. X-ray shows a fracture of the skull without displacement, the injury will be declared as:
The study of quantifiable characteristics of a population is defined as demography. The demographic equation is represented by the sum of:

answers.option: Net migration and crude death rate
Net migration and crude birth rate

question: Neonates who are nutritionally at risk may have birth weight less than:

A patient has had arthritis for 10 years. He has been taking aspirin frequently. After a few months, he came to the outpatient department (OPD) with complaints of gastric pain, retrosternal burning, anorexia, and frequent vomiting. He was diagnosed with a case of aspirin induced peptic ulcer. What is the appropriate drug of choice for this patient?
The number of live births in a year in an area divided by mid-year female population 15-44 in the same area, multiplied by 1000. This is the formula to calculate:
Which of the following is not a feature of squamous cell carcinoma?
Energy expenditure necessary to maintain basic physiologic function under standardized condition(s) is called:

A 41-year-old man has experienced progressive fatigue, pruritus, and jaundice for the past 4 months. He had a total colectomy performed five years ago. On physical examination, he is afebrile and scleral icterus is present. Cholangiography reveals the widespread obliteration of intrahepatic bile ducts. A liver biopsy is performed and microscopic examination shows periductular 'onion skin' fibrosis with a moderate lymphocytic infiltrate. Some intrahepatic bile ducts are obliterated, but there is no interface hepatitis. Which of the following underlying diseases is he most likely to have?

A 38-year-old female patient came to the outpatient department with a complaint of recurrent diarrhea. She is suspected of having Crohn’s disease. A colonoscopy is planned to confirm the diagnosis. Which of the following will be observed in colonoscopy?
Which of the following antibiotics is for the treatment of Whipple disease daily for 1 year (one year)?
What is the confirmatory test for diagnosis of upper GI bleeding?

A 54-year-old male presented to the emergency with complaints of severe pain in the abdomen, and bilious vomiting. There is a bulge about 8 cm lateral to the umbilicus in the line of linea semilunaris. Which of the following is the most likely diagnosis?
A 25-year-old patient is going on a journey with his friends, but he has motion sickness. Which of the following is a prophylactic therapy in his case?
“Undertakers Fracture” due to falling of head (backward) occurs at:
The gastrointestinal tract consists of mucosa, submucosa, muscularis externa, and adventitia. Which of the following germ layer give rise to the epithelium and glands of the mucosal layer?
Self-inflicted cuts are common and they are produced by the person himself or herself to produce false allegations or to neutralize the case. Which of the following is a feature of such wounds?

answers.option: Site can be anywhere in body

question: The body of a young female is brought to a mortuary and when it was examined by a female medico-legal officer, she decided it’s a homicidal cutthroat. One of the positive features of this was:

answers.option: Depth of wound was maximum in the middle
Wound position high up in neck

question: A male of 45 years was brought to a mortuary, features of suicidal cutthroat were visible, it includes:

answers.option: Depth of wound maximum with middle

question: A 50-year-old man has had persistent nausea for 5 years with occasional vomiting. On physical examination, there are no abnormal findings. He undergoes upper gastrointestinal (GI) endoscopy, which shows a small area of gastric fundal mucosa has loss of rugal folds. Biopsies are taken and microscopically reveal well-differentiated adenocarcinoma confined to the mucosa. An upper GI endoscopy performed 5 years previously showed a pattern of gastritis and microscopically there was chronic inflammation. Which of the following is the most likely risk factor for his neoplasm?

A 32-year-old male patient, with a known case of Crohn’s disease, came to the outpatient department (OPD) with complaints of multiple discharging sinuses in the perianal region. What would be the most appropriate radiological investigation to reach the diagnosis in this patient?

A 35-year-old lady presented to the outpatient department (OPD) with intermittent diarrhea, fever, and on and off abdominal pain. Biopsy of this patient shows deep ulcers, marked lymphoid reaction, fibrosis, serositis, granuloma mass, and fistulas. Which of the following is the most likely possibility?
Which of the following is a common cause of anemia in small bowel bacterial overgrowth syndrome?

A 37-year-old man complains of chest pain after meals. He says this pain has gone on for a few months and gets only minimal relief from antacid tablets. The physician prescribes a drug that will decrease the amount of acid secreted by binding to and inhibiting an ATPase on the lumenal surface of parietal cells. Which of the following drugs works by inhibiting the ATPase enzyme?
Volvulus is an abnormal rotation of the intestinal loop (midget), which results in twisting and compromised blood supply of the intestinal loop. Normal rotation of midgut loop is:

A 45-year-old man was diagnosed with hepatitis B infection 2 years ago. Now he came to the outpatient department (OPD) for the follow-up. Recovery from hepatitis B infection is indicated by which of the following negative test?

Three weeks after a meal at a roadside restaurant, a 20-year-old male presents with loss of appetite, malaise, fatigue, and mild yellowness of sclera. Which of the following laboratory test findings is he most likely to have?

A week-old female baby, weighing 3.5 kg, on breast milk feeding, was brought to the outpatient department (OPD) with complaints of yellow discoloration of skin and sclera for the last one week. The baby is passing dark yellow urine and clay-colored stool. On examination, the baby looks well but the liver is grossly enlarged. The most likely diagnosis is:

A 30-year-old male is brought to the emergency department with the complaint of shifting pain in the right lower abdomen for 2 days, which has become severe and generalized to the whole abdomen since morning. He is febrile, has three episodes of vomiting, and is unable to take orally. His pulse is 110 b/min, blood pressure (BP) is 100/70 mmHg, temperature is 100F. He has a tense tender abdomen on palpation with absent bowel sounds. What is the most likely cause of his condition?
Healthy carrier state is indicated by positivity for which of the following in HBV infected patients for more than 6 months?
The combination of ethanol and disulfiram results in nausea and hypertension as a result of the accumulation of which of the following?

A 34-year-old man presents in the gastrointestinal (GI) clinic with abdominal pain, and jaundice. His laboratory investigation confirms that he is positive for hepatitis C infection. Which of the following is true of hepatitis C infection?

answers.option: Hepatitis C virus is a DNA virus
Alpha-interferon is an effective treatment to cure the infection
Persistent infection and chronic hepatitis are the hall marks of the infection

question: A 45-year-old patient diagnosed with Parkinson's disease and currently on maintenance therapy with levodopa. Although his symptoms are well controlled with levodopa, but major disturbing side effects are nausea and vomiting. The physician decided to start an antiemetic that did not affect the antiparkinsonian activity of levodopa. Which of the following antiemetic selectively blocks levodopa-induced vomiting without blocking its antiparkinsonian action?
Foods that have a low glycemic index are considered to be more beneficial because they cause less fluctuation in the secretion of:

A 20-year-old man is healthy but has a family history of colon cancer with onset at a young age. There are no abnormal physical examination findings. He undergoes colonoscopy and there are over 200 tubular adenomas ranging in size from 0.2 to 1 cm on gross inspection and microscopic examination of biopsies. Which of the following genetic diseases is he most likely to have?

A 44-year-old man, an emergency medical technician, has felt fatigued for the past 4 months. On physical examination, there are no remarkable findings. Laboratory studies show his alanine transaminase (ALT) 132 U/L and aspartate transaminase (AST) 113 U/L with total bilirubin 1.3 mg/dL and direct bilirubin 0.8 mg/dL. A liver biopsy is performed, and microscopic examination shows focal necrosis, interface inflammation with the extension of inflammation into the lobules from the triads. There is a ground-glass appearance of hepatocytes. Which of the following laboratory test findings is most characteristic for his disease?

answers.option: Positive anti hepatitis B core antigen
Positive anti hepatitis B surface antigen

question: A 3-year-old child was given one tablet three times a day to control loose motions. The diarrhea stopped but the next day the child was brought in a toxic condition with abdominal distention and vomiting. He had paralytic ileus, mild dehydration, low blood pressure, and sluggish reflexes. Which antidiarrheal drug could have caused this condition?
The salivary secretion from the salivary glands contains different ions. When it is compared with plasma, the saliva has:
Total protein requirement in critical care patients is:
Treatment for parathyroid hyperplasia is:

A 53-year-old woman presents with complaints of weakness, anorexia, malaise, constipation, and back pain. While being evaluated, she becomes somewhat lethargic. Laboratory studies include a normal chest x-ray, serum albumin 3.2 mg/dL, serum calcium 14 mg/dL, serum phosphorus 2.6 mg/dL, serum chloride 108 mg/dL, blood urea nitrogen (BUN) 32 mg/dL, and creatinine 2.0 mg/dL. Which of the following is the most appropriate initial management?

A 23-year-old male is brought to the emergency department with the complaint of pain in right lower abdomen for 5 days, which increases after eating. He has off and on diarrhea, with a history of weight loss for 3 months. He is also having intermittent fever for a few weeks. His pulse is 110 b/min, blood pressure (BP) is 100/70 mmHg and temperature is 100F. On examination, there is a tender palpable mass in the right iliac fossa absent bowel sounds. He also has two discharging fistulas in the peri-anal region. A complete blood picture was performed which depicts hemoglobin (Hb) of 8 gm/dl. What is the most likely cause of his condition?

A 48-year-old female patient is brought to the emergency department (ER) with complaints of severe epigastric pain for 1 day, which became generalized and more severe for 3 hours. Pain is associated with vomiting and even she is unable to tolerate a liquids diet. She has a history of NSAIDs use for osteoarthritis for a long period of time. Her pulse is 120 breaths/min, blood pressure (BP) is 100/60 mmHg, the temperature is afebrile and respiratory rate of 32 breath/min. She has a tense tender abdomen with board-like rigidity. Gut sounds inaudible. What would be the most appropriate radiological investigation to reach the diagnosis in this patient?

A patient returning from a dinner party meets with a road accident and has to be urgently operated upon under general anesthesia. Which of the following drug can be injected intramuscularly to hasten his gastric emptying?

A 43-year-old man has had mid-epigastric pain and nausea for the past 2 months. On physical examination, he has no abnormal findings. On upper GI endoscopy, a solitary sharply demarcated 2-cm shallow gastric antral ulcer is seen. Which of the following laboratory test findings is most likely to be present in this man?
Which of the following infection is associated with nasopharyngeal carcinoma?

A 30-year-old female developed bleeding after excessive bouts of vomiting. The bleeding stopped spontaneously. Upper GI endoscopy showed longitudinal mucosal lacerations in the lower part of the esophagus. What is the likely diagnosis?

A 3-week-old boy is referred for persistent vomiting. He was well until 5 days ago but is now vomiting after each feed, is not putting on weight, and appears jaundiced. After a test, he has a projectile non-bilious vomit. You suspect that he has pyloric stenosis and perform a venous gas and electrolyte analysis. What would you expect the result to reveal

A 50-year-old male with a history of ischemic heart disease presents with blood in the vomitus. There is no history of NSAIDs or steroid use. On examination, there is splenomegaly, ascites, and caput medusa around the umbilicus. Considering the diagnosis, what will be the best treatment option?

A 13-year-old child with a history of type 1 diabetes mellitus presents with intermittent diarrhea, abdominal pain, and vomiting. On examination, he has short stature with anemia, angular stomatitis, and paresthesia. What is the likely clinical diagnosis?
A 22-year-old girl develops severe retching with nausea and vomiting. She later has hematemesis of about 200 ml. Which of the following is the most probable cause of hematemesis?
Regarding the microscopic picture of pyogenic granuloma, which of the following is true?

answers.option: Nodular mass of fibrous tissue with few inflammatory cells
Lobulated masses of capillary sized vessels
Aggregation of multinucleated giant cells separated by highly vascular stroma
Shallow hyperemic ulcerations with predominantly mononuclear inflammatory infiltrate
Epithelioid granuloma with multinucleated giant cells

question: Dry burn is caused by:
Hair singeing is present in:

answers.option: No hair singing in present in burns

question: which of the following is correct regarding the postmortem appearance of arsenic poisoning, when dead body cavities are opened on the autopsy table:

answers.option: Stomach contents shows white particles floating
Capillaries of gastrointestinal are of normal appearance
Hemorrhages in all viscera of body

question: A 25-year-old male presents to the emergency with severe abdominal pain radiating to the back and left shoulder for 24 hours. He has a history of anorexia and vomiting for two days. What is the most likely diagnosis in this patient?

A 26-year-old man suffered a heavy blow on the chin in boxing after which there was the escape of blood and cerebrospinal fluid (CSF) from the nose, and extravasation of blood in the orbit which manifested as a "black eye". Which type of fracture could have led to this?

answers.option: Fracture through the posterior cranial fossa
Fracture through the middle cranial fossa
Fracture through the anterior cranial fossa

question: APC/beta-catenin pathway is the hallmark of which of the following adenocarcinoma?

A comatose patient was brought to the emergency (ER), whose pupils were contracted. On examination, the pupil used to dilate initially by pinching the neck and slowly return to the original size. The person must have taken some toxic substance like:

A 70-year-old patient presents with weakness, tiredness, and muscle cramps. The electrocardiogram (ECG) shows Q-T prolongation, flattening of T wave, and occasional A-V block. His serum K+ is low (2.8 mEq/L). He admitted to taking a laxative every day for the past several months. Which laxative drug could be responsible for the above condition?
The commonest cause of chronic pancreatitis in Western countries is:

A 35-year-old male patient is planning a three-week trip overseas and asks for your advice regarding medications for traveler’s diarrhea. Which of the following drug is suitable for noninfectious travelers’ diarrhea?

A 35-year-old male patient was diagnosed with a peptic ulcer for the past 6 months. He is currently on maintenance therapy with H2 (histamine) receptor blockers along with a mucosal protective agent. Recently he complains of loss of libido and physical examination revealed signs of gynecomastia. Gynecomastia is the most common side effect of which of the following drug?
The gold standard test for diagnosis of celiac disease is:

A comatose patient reports in the emergency department at Dow Hospital with suspected poisoning. On clinical examination, he has brownish oral mucosa and tongue, constricted pupil, and has passed greenish-brown urine in his trousers. What is the most likely cause?
Methods of investigation of the biliary system do not include:

A 26-year-old woman has had bloody, mucoid, low-volume diarrhea for the past six weeks. The stool frequency is five per day. She is afebrile, with no abdominal mass or tenderness. Stool examination reveals only mucous and blood with few leukocytes, no ova or parasites seen. Colonoscopy shows a friable, erythematous mucosa extending from the rectum to the middle of the descending colon. Rectal biopsy shows acute mucosal inflammation with cryptitis and crypt abscesses. Which of the following is the most probable diagnosis?

A 27-year-male has a bout of profuse vomiting during a barbecue party. He complains of shortness of breath and severe lower chest pain and upper abdominal pain. On examination, he is tachypneic and tachycardia . There is rigidity of the upper abdomen. What is the most likely diagnosis?

An 8-year-old boy had a sudden episode of nausea, vomiting, and profuse rice watery diarrhea. He developed dehydration, circulatory collapse, and anuria due to rapid loss of fluid and electrolytes. Which one of the following bacteria is most probably involved?

A 28-year-old lady falls from a scooter and gets minor abrasions on the arm and forearm and bruising of the scalp. After reaching home, she has a quarrel with her husband, receives mild blows on the face, and later dies. Autopsy reveals 100 ml of blood beneath a fractured skull at the site of the bruise. What is the probable cause of death?

A 30-year-old girl ingested an unknown substance and died. A post-mortem was carried out to find the cause of death. The oral cavity showed a diffuse grayish-white escharotic appearance. Also, the gastrointestinal (GI) tract was inflamed but the cecum and large intestine showed intense inflammation along with gangrene. What do you think is the probable substance she ingested?

A 30-year-old male patient comes into a rehabilitation center. He is an alcohol addict who wants to go for withdrawal treatment. What drug will you prescribe to this patient that will sensitize him to even a small dose of alcohol?

A 30-year-old man got hit on the vertex of the head that led to a fracture of the base of the skull. However, on examination, the bruise was found on the mastoid process behind the ears. What could be the reason for these positive findings of bruises on the mastoid processes?

A 30-year-old man met a road traffic accident, while he was riding a bike. The collision made his body drag on the road before he stopped by hitting a nearby tree. On examination, he was found to have superficial injuries involving only superficial layers of skin. What is the most probable injury he has sustained?

A postgraduate surgical trainee has been asked to do closure of midline rectus sheath by the consultant. Which one of the following statements is correct in order to close the wound and avoid future hernias?

answers.option: Length of the suture should be 3:1 of the wound length
Length of suture should be 1:1 of the wound length
Length of suture should be 4:1 of the wound length
Length of the suture should be 5:1 of the wound length
Length of suture should be 1:2 of the wound length

question: A 25-year-old man has noted cramping abdominal pain for the past week. On physical examination, there is right upper quadrant tenderness. Laboratory studies show increased serum transaminases. A liver biopsy was performed, and microscopic examination showed focal necrosis, interface inflammation with the extension of inflammation into the lobules from the portal triad. Which of the following is the most likely cause?

A 30-year-old man underwent surgery for a road traffic accident, during which the surgeon notices the presence of a submucosal mass in the ileum. On microscopic examination, mass is composed of nests of cells with uniform round nuclei and cytoplasm with small purple granules. Immunohistochemical stain chromogranin is positive in these cells. Which of the following is most likely diagnosis?
A 35-year-old female presents to the outpatient department with obstructive jaundice. Her ultrasound showed stones in the common bile duct. What is the best management?

A 35-year-old man comes to the emergency with complaints of severe abdominal pain and after evaluation, bowel perforation is suspected. His erect abdominal X-ray is performed. What is the most likely finding on an erect abdominal X-ray?

A 35-year-old man complains of pain in the abdomen for 3 months and nausea for 1 week. His stool sample is positive for occult blood. An upper GI endoscopy reveals normal esophageal mucosa, but a solitary 2 cm diameter shallow, sharply demarcated ulceration of the stomach is seen. Which of the following is most pertinent for this lesion?

A 38-year-old man sitting on his terrace enjoying a cup of tea was suddenly hit on the head by a ricocheting glancing bullet that grazed his head and removed a part of the thickness of bone. What is this fracture called?

A 38-year-old businessman is on a trip to the United States where he develops diarrhea. He has to give a presentation in a few hours and needs rapid relief. He takes an antidiarrheal preparation containing loperamide. Which of the following is a property of loperamide that makes it useful in treating diarrhea?

A 38-year-old woman consults you before her planning to spend summer holidays in Gilgit and Swat with her husband and a 12-year-old boy. They never had hepatitis or liver disease in the past and none of them have had immunization against hepatitis. Which of the following plans would you recommend for the family?

answers.option: Screen all members of the family for Hepatitis A and B exposure
Hepatitis A and Hepatitis B vaccination for both parents and the child
Hepatitis A vaccination for parents and child and Hepatitis B vaccination for the child
Hepatitis A vaccination for both parents and child
Screen parents for previous Hepatitis A infection, and recommend Hepatitis A vaccination for the child

question: A 40-year-old man who worked in the dye finishing industry for 20 years comes in with complaints of colic & bluish-black lines on the gums. Complete blood count along with peripheral smear shows anemia along with punctate basophilia in red blood cells. In the light of positive findings, what is the most probable diagnosis?
A 40-year-old female presents to the outpatient department with history of recurrent pain in right hypochondrium. Pain is aggravated with fatty meals. What is the mostly likely diagnosis?

A 42-year-old man comes with a history of chronic intake of alcohol. On examination, he has a firm liver that is not enlarged. CT scan reveals a cirrhotic liver. He is then sent to a rehabilitation centre to quit his drinking habit. In spite of complete abstinence from alcohol, he most likely remains at risk of developing which of the following diseases?

A 43-year-old female develops severe epigastric and penetrating back pain following a dinner party. She was in shock when brought to the hospital. Which one of the following laboratory investigations would be most helpful in early diagnosis?

A 43-year-old man complains of epigastric pain and nausea for 3 months. On physical examination, there are no abnormal findings. Upper GI endoscopy reveals a solitary sharply demarcated 2-cm shallow gastric ulcer at the antrum. Which of the following laboratory test findings is most relevant in this man?

A 35-year-old woman who immigrated to the United States from Pakistan comes to the outpatient clinic complaining of anorexia, nausea, and abdominal pain. Lab investigations reveal a positive hepatitis-B surface antigen ( HBsAg). She is then started on therapy with Adefovir Dipivoxil. To avoid resistance with which of the following drugs can Adefovir Dipivoxil be used as adjuvant therapy?
A 45-year-old female is diagnosed with chronic cholecystitis due to cholelithiasis. What is the best treatment option?

A 50-year-old male presents with blood in the vomitus. There is no history of NSAIDs or steroids use. On examination, there is splenomegaly, caput medusa around the umbilicus, and positive shifting dullness. Given this history and examination, what is the most likely cause of upper GI bleeding?

A 50-year-old male presents with his investigations showing HBsAg positive, HBeAg negative, ALT 120 IU/ml, and HBV DNA >10,000 IU/ml. His fibro scan shows an F3 score. What is the best option to start with?
A 50-year-old male presents with heartburn, epigastric pain, and regurgitation for 2 weeks. His examination is unremarkable. What is the treatment of choice?
A 55-year-old man with a history of ulcerative colitis for the last 20 years presents with a left iliac fossa mass. Which of the following can be the most likely diagnosis?
A 55-year-old male presents to the emergency room with fever, chills & rigors. He has right hypochondrial pain and jaundice. What is the most appropriate diagnosis?

A 60-year-old male with small bowel diverticulosis presents with steatorrhea. He undergoes certain investigations including a hydrogen breath test which is positive. Which of the following condition should be considered in this case?
A 60-year-old man with known ulcerative colitis presents with an acutely distended, tender abdomen. Which of the following is the most likely diagnosis?
A 60-year-old male presents with melena. Which of the following would be the most useful investigation?
A blood relative of a patient with FAP (familial adenomatous polyposis) has a biopsy taken from a chronic polyp. Which of the following histological results is most likely?
A child aged 3 years presents with congestion and is accidentally diagnosed as a case of chronic child abuse. What will the X-ray findings be?

A patient presents with abdominal pain and frequent unsatisfactory bowel movements. For the last year, he has been using a purgative twice weekly to ease his bowel movements. On colonoscopy, the colon is found to be atonic with bluish pigmentation of the mucosa. Which is the most likely purgative that the patient has been using?
A patient presents with severe abdominal pain. Endoscopy reveals a benign ulcer in the antral mucosa. Select the drug that provides fastest relief from discomfort with a single dose:
A premature newborn has abdominal distention and several episodes of bloody diarrhea. What is the most likely diagnosis in this patient?
What is the state of complete emaciation called?

A young boy got hit during a fight by a baseball bat. It was a blunt injury with a perpendicular impact which resulted in a linear opening of the skin overlying the scalp. It resembled an incised wound. What is your most probable diagnosis of the type of injury he has sustained?

A young girl is attacked by thieves who badly injure her with knives. On examination, the wounds are present on her body and arm, clearly cut with no bruising at the wound edges. Gaping is also noted at the edges. In light of the above findings, what is the most probable diagnosis?

A 29-year-old male presents to the outpatient department with a complaint of recurrent abdominal pain for the last 1 year, mostly in the lower abdomen that is relieved by defecation. He is also giving the history of increased frequency of stools approximately 3-4 times per day. He does not have weight loss & nighttime awakening due to these symptoms. On examination, he is vitally stable. Systemic and general physical examinations are unremarkable. Complete blood count and ESR are normal. What is the most probable diagnosis?

A 3-week-old male is referred for persistent vomiting. He was well until 5 days ago but is now vomiting with each feed and is not putting on weight. After a test feed, he has projectile non-bilious vomiting. What is the most likely diagnosis?

A 32-year-old female presents with an altered level of consciousness and irritability for one day. On examination, she is pale and jaundiced. Her blood pressure is 160/100 mm Hg, pulse is 55 beats/min, respiratory rate is 32/min. Tender hepatomegaly is also present. On inquiry, she gives a history of yellow discoloration of sclera & skin for the last 7 days. Lab results show a hemoglobin level of 11.2 gm/dl, total white blood cell count of 12000/mm3, platelet level of 332,000/mm3. Liver function tests show total bilirubin of 15 mg/dl, direct bilirubin of 5 mg /dl, serum glutamic pyruvic transaminase of 3000 IU/L, alkaline phosphatase of 680 IU/L, prothrombin time of 60 sec, and International normalized ratio= 3.5. She is in grade 3 encephalopathy. The most common cause of this presentation will be?
